projections
  • Reference
  • News

Plot projections objects

This method is designed for plotting projections objects, output by the function project. It plots the mean projected incidence, as well as lower and upper bounds defined by quantiles.

# S3 method for projections
plot(x, y = c(0.05, 0.95), col = "red", ...)

Arguments

x
A projections object.
y
A vector of 2 quantiles to plot
col
A vector (recycled if needed) of up to 3 colors for the median, lower and upper quantiles.
...
Further arguments to be passed to other methods (not used).

Examples


if (require(outbreaks) &&
    require(distcrete) &&
    require(incidence)) {

si <- distcrete("gamma", interval = 1L,
                 shape = 0.37,
                 scale = 41.4, w = 0)

i <- incidence(ebola_sim$linelist$date_of_onset)
plot(i)

## add projections after the first 100 days, over 60 days
set.seed(1)
proj <- project(x = i[1:100], R = 2.1, si = si, n_days = 60)

## plotting projections
plot(proj)

## adding them to incidence plot
plot(i[1:160], proj = proj)

## same, with customised colors
plot(i[1:160], proj = plot(proj, col = c("red", "gold", "gold")))

}
#> Loading required package: outbreaks
